ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Bookmark 'stability'
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, ... If there’s no stability, how can a REST system possibly work? Okay, right, hypermedia… (assuming that at least the starting URI remains stable)

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Bookmark 'stability'
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=466918125; y=-ijhG-16IkWNdXzIWF8_hZhPeaFgxIHvLzvlMskPlXrucuh1kqw473M

Hi all,

> "Cool URIs don't change" is not a RESTful principle.

If there=
=92s no stability, how can a REST system possibly work?
Okay, right, hyperm=
edia=85 (assuming that at least the starting URI remains stable)
but we can=
't expect clients to navigate to the desired resource every time again, can=
 we?

And, also:
=93The naming authority that assigned the resource identif=
ier, making it possible to reference the resource, is responsible for maint=
aining the semantic validity of the mapping over time (i.e., ensuring that =
the membership function does not change).=94
(http://www.ics.uci.edu/~field=
ing/pubs/dissertation/rest_arch_style.htm#sec_5_2_1_1)

A 404 certainly cha=
nges the membership function if the resource is still accessible through an=
other URI.

Best,

Ruben
